channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MD
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MD

item.title: Report X-2023060920
item.description:
Report X-2023060920

  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: THE PACKAGE WAS FOUND LEAKING DURING SORTATION. DescribePack: THE CAP CAME LOOSE ON THE GLASS BOTTLE CAUSING THE CONTENTS TO LEAK OUT. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A LINED TOTE FOR PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2023060903
item.description:
Report X-2023060903

  • City: BELTSVILLE

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: I found wet package in the damage hazmat cage. I repackaged damage in a salvage drum and submitted all required reports. DescribePack: There was internal leakage from loose cap on all containers. About 1 cup of content spilled. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The wet package was placed in a tub and taken to the damage hazmat area.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found headed to loadside, wet and leaking. Immediately placed in plastic tote and brought to QA for processing. DescribePack: Cap was loose and seal on it did not hold fluids that leaked out. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: Placed in plastic lined tote and brought to QA immediately for processing.

DescribePack: There is one hole on the side of one of the bottles. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in a lined Haz Mat tote immediately upon discovery.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-26
  • City: LAUREL
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER CALLED TO RED SLIDE FOR A LEAKING PACKAGE. RESPONDED WITH FULL PPE, DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEET. RESPONDER NOTED PACKAGE HAD A CORROSIVE LABEL AND MOST OF THE LIQUID WAS CONTAINED BY THE OUTER PACKAGING. THERE WAS A SMALL PUDDLE ON THE FLOOR AND THE RESPONDER FOLLOWED THE RESPONSE SHEET, CONTAINED THE PACKAGE AND RETURNED TO THE DMP FOR PROCESSING.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: discovered damaged on work area 565.outer container was wet.upon inspection cap came loose causing approx 10 oz of content to leak out. DescribePack: failure was due to loose cap causing internal leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: chemical neutralizer was used on spill.package was placed in hazmat tote and put underventilation system.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: THE PACKAGE WAS FOUND LEAKING AND IMPROPERLY LOADED ON ITS SIDE ON THE UNLOAD TRAILER FROM THE PREVIOUS FACILITY. DescribePack: THE CAP CAME LOOSE AND THE ORIENTATION ARROWS WERE NOT RESPECTED CAUSING THE CONTENTS TO LEAK OUT. IT CAUSED DAMAGE TO 2 OTHER HAZMAT PACKAGES. DurationRel: 20 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A LINED TOTE FOR PROCESSING.

DescribePack: The crack seems to be about 3 inches long toward the top of the jug. Hopefully, there will be no farther leaking from the jug. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: The box was picked up and placed in a plastic bun until I was able to get around to doing the reports.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE FOUND IN UNLOAD, PLACED IN HAZMAT BAG AND BIN. TAKEN TO HAZMAT AREA FOR EVALUATION. DescribePack: ONE OF THE BOTTLES HAD A LOOSE CAP. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: ABSOBANT PADS, PLASTIC BAG AND BIN USED TO TRANSPORT THE PRODUCT.
